subject: Re: [junit] Re: JUnit Recipes
msgSnippet: ... Ah, the irony of _JUnit Recipes_: the short recipes were orginially meant to make it easy to read an article or three on the train. If only I d stopped
messageBody:
Shane Mingins wrote:
> I tend to like a book too, although that is basically
> for ease of reading. I bought the PDF form and print
> chapters to read on the train (a lot lighter to carry
> than a full book). But I love the ease of use of the
> PDF to go back an find things!

Ah, the irony of _JUnit Recipes_: the short recipes were orginially
meant to make it easy to read an article or three on the train. If only
I'd stopped after 400 pages, it wouldn't be so heavy to lug on the train!

> Plus for me the price was great as shipping to NZ was
> free ;-) With my last book purchase from Amazon the
> shipping cost was over half the cost of the book! The
> price to pay for living in the best part of the world
> I s'pose :-)

Well... /one of/ the best parts of the world. (I don't know; I've never
been.)
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
